title: Live coverage: SpaceX to launch 500th Starlink satellite in 2026 during Wednesday Falcon 9 flight
summary: The Starlink 17-26 mission will also be the 540th launch of a previously flown Falcon booster. Liftoff from pad 4 East at Vandenberg Space Force Base is scheduled for 6:17:49 a.m. PST (9:17:49 a.m. EST / 1417:49 UTC).

title: In space traffic coordination, the biggest challenge may be coordination
summary:
As the number of satellites in orbit grows, one emerging challenge is the difficulty some satellite operators have contacting counterparts to avoid potential collisions.
The post In space traffic coordination, the biggest challenge may be coordination appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: OQ Technology secures $30 million from Europe for satellite-to-smartphone expansion
summary:
Europe’s investment arm is lending Luxembourg-based OQ Technology 25 million euros ($30 million) to expand its direct-to-device constellation, bolstering the continent’s push to compete with U.S.-led efforts to connect smartphones from space.
The post OQ Technology secures $30 million from Europe for satellite-to-smartphone expansion appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: AAC Clyde Space adds Sedna satellites to boost maritime data services
summary:
London, UK (SPX) Feb 20, 2026

AAC Clyde Space has started building two additional maritime data satellites, Sedna-3 and Sedna-4, to expand capacity in its established space-based maritime data services. The company has placed orders for key components and assigned the build to its U.S. subsidiary AAC SpaceQuest, aiming to support continuity of service and improve performance as its fleet renews

title: Ganymede aurora study links moon and Earth space weather
summary:
London (SDX) Feb 25, 2026


New observations of Jupiter's largest moon, Ganymede, reveal that its auroras share detailed structural similarities with auroras on Earth, suggesting that the physical processes that generate these lights may be universal across different types of celestial bodies.

title: Superconducting thruster cuts power and mass for space propulsion
summary:
Singapore (SDX) Feb 25, 2026


Small satellites have become attractive for space missions because they offer low cost and flexibility, but their growth has been limited by the lack of compact, efficient propulsion systems that work well in the vacuum of space. title: AST SpaceMobile wins SDA HALO Europa contract for direct to device tactical links
summary:
New York (SDX) Feb 23, 2026


AST SpaceMobile has secured a prime contract worth about 30 million dollars with the United States Space Development Agency for the Europa Track 2 Commercial Solutions program under the Hybrid Acquisition for proliferated Low Earth Orbit, or HALO, initiative.

title: Seafloor weathering may explain ancient global glaciation puzzle
summary:
New York (SDX) Feb 25, 2026


In Earth history, a few episodes stand out for their extreme cold, when geologic evidence indicates that ice covered the planet from pole to pole during so-called Snowball Earth events. These episodes represent some of the coldest conditions the planet has ever experienced, with the entire surface essentially below the freezing point of water. title: Rare lensed supernova offers new route to measure cosmic expansion
summary:
London (SDX) Feb 25, 2026


That the universe is expanding has been known for almost a century, but its exact rate of expansion remains one of cosmology's most hotly debated questions. title: Infleqtion lists shares on NYSE as neutral atom quantum firm
summary:
Los Angeles CA (SPX) Feb 20, 2026


Infleqtion, a provider of neutral atom based quantum computing and sensing systems, has completed its business combination with Churchill Capital Corp X and is now listed on the New York Stock Exchange under the ticker symbol INFQ.
